Municipal Zoning Ordinance

RESIDENTIAL DISTRICTS

    Single Family Residential
        Lot size minimum: 5000 square feet
        Maximum building height: 35 feet
        Front setback: 25 feet
        Side setback: 10 feet
        Rear setback: 20 feet
        Maximum lot coverage: 40 percent

    Multi Family Residential
        Lot size minimum: 10000 square feet
        Maximum building height: 45 feet
        Front setback: 20 feet
        Side setback: 15 feet
        Rear setback: 25 feet
        Maximum density: 20 dwelling units per acre
        Parking requirement: 1.5 spaces per dwelling unit

    Planned Development Residential
        Minimum project area: 5 acres
        Maximum building height: 50 feet
        Open space requirement: 30 percent of total area
        Density bonus available for affordable housing units

COMMERCIAL DISTRICTS

    Neighborhood Commercial
        Permitted uses: retail, office, restaurant, personal services
        Maximum building height: 40 feet
        Front setback: 10 feet
        Parking requirement: 1 space per 250 square feet
        Maximum floor area ratio: 1.5

    General Commercial
        Permitted uses: all neighborhood commercial plus entertainment
        Maximum building height: 60 feet
        Front setback: 5 feet
        Parking requirement: 1 space per 300 square feet
        Maximum floor area ratio: 3.0

    Highway Commercial
        Permitted uses: automobile services, large retail, hospitality
        Maximum building height: 45 feet
        Minimum lot frontage: 100 feet
        Parking requirement: 1 space per 200 square feet

INDUSTRIAL DISTRICTS

    Light Industrial
        Permitted uses: manufacturing, warehousing, research facilities
        Maximum building height: 50 feet
        Minimum lot size: 20000 square feet
        Buffer requirement: 50 feet from residential districts

    Heavy Industrial
        Permitted uses: heavy manufacturing, processing, storage
        Maximum building height: 75 feet
        Minimum lot size: 40000 square feet
        Buffer requirement: 200 feet from residential districts
        Environmental impact assessment required

SPECIAL PROVISIONS

    Variances may be granted by the zoning board of appeals upon
    demonstration of practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship.

    Conditional use permits may be issued for uses not expressly
    permitted in a given district when the proposed use is compatible
    with the character of the surrounding area.

    Non-conforming uses existing at the time of adoption of this
    ordinance may continue subject to the restrictions outlined in
    the non-conforming use provisions.
